references.paper_title: Graph based anomaly detection and description: a survey
references.reason: This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of graph anomaly detection methods, laying the groundwork for understanding the landscape of existing techniques and identifying areas for improvement.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a crucial component in many modern graph anomaly detection methods, significantly impacting the field's development.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This influential work presents inductive representation learning on graphs, a key technique used in many graph anomaly detection models for effective feature extraction and representation.
This paper introduces a simplified version of graph convolutional networks, which improves efficiency and has been widely adopted in graph-related tasks, including anomaly detection.

references.paper_title: How powerful are graph neural networks?
references.reason: This paper provides theoretical insights into the power and limitations of graph neural networks, offering a valuable understanding of the underlying mechanisms and their effectiveness in complex graph-based tasks such as anomaly detection.
